definitions.definition: The state of being a minor; youth, the period of a person's life prior to reaching adulthood.
Any subgroup that does not form a numerical majority.
definitions.example: Most people agreed, but a sizable minority were upset by the decision.

definitions.definition: (used attributively of a party, government, etc.) Empowered by or representing a minority (usually a plurality) of votes cast, legislative seats, etc., rather than an outright majority thereof.
A member of an ethnic minority.
definitions.example: The company claims it has hired several minorities since the complaint was lodged.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to a minority.
definitions.example: They hold a minority interest in the company.
